ygData.subject: Re: My Yk!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh I only expect to stay out of the lottos for the Efreeti. SMR rolling is ok by me. Personally I don t roll for haste sash s if somebody else can use I e
ygData.messageBody:
Heh I only expect to stay out of the lottos for the Efreeti. SMR rolling is
ok by me. Personally I don't roll for haste sash's if somebody else can use
I'e never touched a sash in my life. Yaks are another thing though those
thigs are common as hell. Efreeti are a pain in the ass to get so I don't
want melee classes rolloing for them. SMR I'd prefer they not only because
they are rare but it's ok by me if you do roll.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Rokenn Swiftsong <rokenn@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, January 06, 2000 11:13 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] My Yk!!!


>Ya but if you do not give your Bard any love, you may be looking for
someone
>to fill his/her slot in the group. Now-adays we have to role against
>casters for yaks/FBSS's, but when we (Bard's) help these same classes to
>camp for a SMR/Efreeti boots they expect us to stay out of the lottos. Go
>figure.
>
>Rokenn
>
>
>>From: "Dark" <jackal@...>
>>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] My Yk!!!
>>Date: Fri, 7 Jan 2000 10:48:50 -0500
>>
>>Yah but it makes pretty good sense when you think about it. Now I know now
>>a
>>days people don't do this but people always use to bring two full groups
>>into the room to break it nothing like it is now. Of all the people how
>>often does a bard really melee at that level? A war? Personally I just
>>think
>>them lee classes should get the first yak and then a bard who I still
>>can't
>>decide what to call it besides bard. They don't seem like a melee class to
>>me at high leels butrather a support utility.
>>
>>Naeeldar
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: jhenders@... <jhenders@...>
>>To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
>>Date: Thursday, January 06, 2000 5:38 AM
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] My Yk!!!
>>
>>
>> >On Wed, Jan 05/00, "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)"
>><Michael.Garramone@...> wrote:
>> >> that's how it is in our raids. our guild has set up a pretty complex
>>but
>> >> fair system of lottos as of late, as all we do are planes and dragons.
>>lot
>> >> of stuff is like this, like mistwalkers are rangers before druids,
>>staff
>>is
>> >> priests before paladins, etc. we had a vox raid have a paladin win
the
>> >> staff and druid win a mistwalker, that was pretty much the last straw
>>for
>>a
>> >> lot of people.
>> >
>> >Isn't this a bit of a double standard? I assume people were upset
>> >because a ranger is better at melee and thus theoretically could have
>> >made use of the mistwalker more than a druid, yet the staff (forbidden
>> >rites I assume) is also a pretty kick butt melee weapon and just as
>> >useless in the hands of a cleric as the mistwalker would be in the hands
>> >of a druid.
>> >
>> >This is also the same kind of attitude that was used to keep Bards out
>> >of the early lottos for Ykeshas on my server and it still pisses me off.
>> >
>> >
